figure.caption: Figure 99. Standard and Forward Position "X" Bar

note.para: The standard position "X" bar top cover assembly and the forward position "X" top cover assembly use different housings. The forward housing also uses a plate and a gasket installed over the detent balls and springs.

step1.para: On forward top covers, remove the bolts that fasten the detent spring cover plate (if installed) to the top cover assembly. Remove the plate and the gasket.

note.para: If a heavy-duty detent spring is used, the spring (different color) is in the bore on the slave valve side of the transmission.

step1.para: Remove the three detent springs and balls from the top of the housing (Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Remove Detent Springs and Balls

note.para: On standard position top cover assemblies, two reverse switches may be used. On forward position housings, one reverse switch is used.

step1.para: Remove the reverse switches or plugs from the housing. Remove the long pins from each bore ( Figure 102).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Remove Reverse Switches and Long Pins

step1.para: If necessary, remove the breather from the top of the cover (Figure 103).
Remove the neutral safety switch or plug. Remove the short pin from the bore ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Remove Neutral Safety Switch and Short Pin

caution.para: Do not damage the machined surface of the case. If the surface is damaged, the case will leak.

step1.para: Put the top cover assembly on the bench so that the forks are toward you or in a vice with brass protectors on the jaws of the vise.
Remove the bolts that fasten the large and small oil scoops to the cover (Figure 104).

figure.caption: Figure 104. Remove Bolts Fastening Large and Small Oil Scoops

step1.para: Remove the lock wire from the following (Figure 105):
Remove the set screw from the 3rd-4th fork and the 3rd-4th shift fork shaft from the housing. Remove the 3rd-4th fork (Figure 106).
Remove the set screw and remove the 3-4 shift sleeve shaft from the housing. Remove the 3-4 X-bar sleeve (Figure 107).
Remove the interlock ball from the bottom of the top bore of the first set of bores at the rear of the housing (Figure 108).
Remove the interlock pin from the end of the 1-2 shift shaft (Figure 109).
Remove the set screws and remove the 1-2 shift shaft, the 1-2 shift fork and the 1-2 shift sleeve from the housing (Figure 110).

figure.caption: Figure 110. Remove 1-2 Shift Shaft, Shift Fork and Shift Sleeve

step1.para: Remove the interlock ball from the bottom of the middle bore in the first set of bores in the rear of the housing (Figure 111).

caution.para: Remove the O-ring on the guide pin before removing the rocking lever and the spacer plate or the O-ring will be damaged.

step1.para: Remove the nut and the plate that fasten the guide pin and the rocking lever assembly to the housing. Remove the O-ring from the guide pin. Remove the rocking lever and the spacer plate ( Figure 112).
Inspect the O-ring on the guide pin. Replace the O-ring if worn or damaged.

figure.caption: Figure 112. Remove O-Ring, Rocking Lever, and Spacer Plate

step1.para: Remove the neutral check shaft from the top cover assembly (Figure 113).
Remove set screws and remove the low-reverse shift shaft. Remove the low-reverse shift sleeve and fork assembly (Figure 114).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Remove Low-Reverse Shift Shaft, Shift Sleeve and Fork Assembly

step1.para: If necessary, disassemble the low-reverse sleeve and fork assembly. Remove the clip that fastens the plunger in the housing. Remove the plunger and the spring. Remove the spring and the ball from the bore next to the plunger bore (Figure 115).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.
